The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

body.p:
Kenton Circuit Court
December Term. Jany 12 1864.
Commonwealth agst. Geo Oakes No 770 Indicted

Came the parties and Deft. plead not Guilty thereupon came a Jury viz. H McDonald, W Martin, A Craig, John O Donnell, W Maloney, F M Royes, J C Wilson, A Dearing, Sam Eggelston W. L. Shrock, H Crout and C Hunbook, who being duly sworn well and truly to try the issue after hearing the evidence returned the following virdict. We the Jury find the Defendant Guilty as charged in the Indictment and fix his fine at $200. John O Donnell. foreman, Wherefore. it is adjudged that Defendant make his fine to the Commonwealth of Kentucky in the sum of $200 and his costs herein expended.
The attachment against Ellidon Davis absent witness herein is discharged at his costs

Copy att. B. W.Foley Clerk
By Joe P Harris D C
Fee 50Â¢

No 770
Kenton Circuit Court
The Commonwealth of Kentucky Plff
against } Indictment for Suffering gaming in his house
George Oakes
The Grand Jury of Kenton County in the name and by the authority of the Commonwealth of Kentucky accuse George Oakes of the offence of suffering gaming in his house. committed as follows viz.

The said George Oakes. in the County Circuit and State aforesaid on the day of September 1863. and on divers other days and times before and since that time and before the finding of this Indictment did then and there suffer divers persons to play games of cards and other games in a house in his occupation and under his control at which said games money and property was then and there won and lost. contrary to the statute in such case made and provided and against the peace and dignity of the Commonwealth of Kentucky.

WitnessesJoseph Blackwell
Elm Moore
Ellison Davis
R. B. Carpenter
Commonwealth s Atty.
